alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 12:26AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Thunderstorms producing heavy rain will impact portions of northwestern Johnson, southern Benton, southwestern Linn and Iowa Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1223 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain producing thunderstorms along a line extending from near Toledo to 6 miles south of Oxford. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain and lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding of low lying areas. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Oxford around 1235 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Coralville, Tiffin, North Liberty, Oakdale, Keystone, Iowa City and Van Horne. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 212 and 244. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
